intro: Stephania bancroftii, commonly known as the Florida cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are followed by red, fleshy fruits containing seeds. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
